author: CÃ©sar Reyes
title: Consejo de transiciÃ³n de 9 personas asume el poder en HaitÃ­ en medio de la crisis de violencia
text:
Este jueves se consumÃ³ la renuncia del primer ministro de HaitÃ­, Ariel Henry, al tiempo que fue juramentado un consejo integrado por nueve representantes polÃ­ticos y de la sociedad civil que tomarÃ¡ las riendas del paÃ­s caribeÃ±o sumido en la violencia.
El ministro de finanzas de Henry, Patrick Boisvert , fue nombrado primer ministro interino.
Desde principios de este aÃ±o, grupos criminales han tomado el control de grandes zonas del paÃ­s, incluyendo un 90% de su capital, Puerto PrÃ­ncipe.
El germen de la crisis actual se remonta al asesinato del presidente Jovenel MoÃ¯se , ocurrido en julio de 2021, y que dejÃ³ al paÃ­s en un vacÃ­o institucional, y sin celebrar elecciones desde entonces.
Henry, quien tomÃ³ el poder con el apoyo de EE.UU. y la comunidad internacional luego de la muerte de Moise, dimitiÃ³ a travÃ©s de una carta que redactÃ³ exiliado en Los Ãngeles, California.
Las pandillas le habÃ­an impedido regresar al paÃ­s desde el pasado marzo, cuando viajÃ³ a Kenia en busca de ayuda de las fuerzas de seguridad de esa naciÃ³n africana para lidiar con la crisis interna de su paÃ­s.
â€œMe solidarizo con las pÃ©rdidas y el sufrimiento de nuestros compatriotas durante este perÃ­odo. En nombre del gobierno, agradezco al pueblo haitiano por la oportunidad de servir a nuestro paÃ­s con integridad, sabidurÃ­a y honorâ€, dijo Henry en la misiva con fecha del 24 de abril, pero que fue publicada este jueves en redes sociales.
El gobierno saliente de HaitÃ­ formalizÃ³ el proceso de transiciÃ³n hace dos semanas, un mes despuÃ©s de que Henry anunciara que iba a dejar su cargo, cuando las pandillas asediaron el aeropuerto en el que debÃ­a aterrizar luego de su viaje oficial.
Ante el anuncio de la juramentaciÃ³n, la Casa Blanca mostrÃ³ su apoyo.
â€œHoy se da un paso fundamental hacia elecciones libres y justasâ€, dijo el portavoz del Consejo de Seguridad Nacional, John Kirby, y aÃ±adiÃ³ que el embajador de Estados Unidos estuvo en la ceremonia y que su paÃ­s ha entregado un primer envÃ­o de equipo no letal a la policÃ­a haitiana.
SegÃºn datos de la Oficina Integrada de las Naciones Unidas en HaitÃ­, mÃ¡s de 2.500 personas han muerto o han resultado heridas por el caos que vive la isla desde enero.
Getty Images: Ariel Henry. Una juramentaciÃ³n amenazada El consejo fue creado para elaborar un plan restablezca el orden en HaitÃ­. Sus nueve miembros deberÃ¡n organizar unas elecciones, aunque para ello no se estableciÃ³ una fecha especÃ­fica.
El grupo cuenta nuevamente con el apoyo de EE.UU. y la Comunidad del Caribe (Caricom), la organizaciÃ³n regional que ha vigilado el proceso de transiciÃ³n preocupada por la inestabilidad que la crisis en HaitÃ­ puede provocar en los paÃ­ses vecinos.
Sus integrantes provienen de diversos partidos polÃ­ticos y de la sociedad civil.
La ceremonia de juramentaciÃ³n, que debÃ­a celebrarse en el Palacio Nacional, tuvo que llevarse a cabo en la oficina del primer ministro, conocida como Villa dâ€™Accueil, por la amenaza de los grupos violentos .
Este miÃ©rcoles se escucharon disparos en las inmediaciones del Palacio e, incluso, la policÃ­a tuvo que usar gases lacrimÃ³genos para dispersar a una multitud que rodeaba sus inmediaciones.
Las pandillas habÃ­an prometido descarrilar la juramentaciÃ³n , y uno de los lÃ­deres mÃ¡s poderosos de estos grupos lanzÃ³ una amenaza en un video en las redes sociales que parecÃ­a estar dirigido al consejo.
â€œYa sea que estÃ©n instalados o no, este mensaje es para ustedes: prepÃ¡renseâ€, advirtiÃ³ Jimmy ChÃ©rizier .
ChÃ©rizier, tambiÃ©n conocido como Barbecue, es la figura mÃ¡s destacada de una alianza informal de pandillas conocida como Viv Ansanm (Vivir Juntos), que tiene el control de Puerto PrÃ­ncipe.
El mes pasado, dijo que considerarÃ­a deponer las armas si se permitiera a los grupos armados participar en las conversaciones para establecer el nuevo gobierno.
Dijo que â€œno estaba orgullosoâ€ de la espiral de violencia en HaitÃ­ y advirtiÃ³ que la crisis podrÃ­a continuar si grupos como el suyo, que critican a los â€œpolÃ­ticos corruptosâ€, no forman parte de un futuro gobierno.
La situaciÃ³n en HaitÃ­ ha sido descrita como â€œcataclÃ­smicaâ€ por Naciones Unidas en un informe publicado el mes pasado.
Un informe detalla las â€œprÃ¡cticas desgarradorasâ€ de las pandillas, a las que se acusa de utilizar la violencia extrema y el abuso sexual como medio de castigo y control.
Los grupos de ayuda humanitaria tienen dificultades para llevar alimentos y agua a la capital, donde millones de personas no tienen sustento y estÃ¡n al borde de la hambruna.
Getty Images: MÃ¡s de 2.000 personas han muerto o han resultado heridas desde enero en HaitÃ­, de acuerdo con las Naciones Unidas. BBC: Haz clic aquÃ­ para leer mÃ¡s historias de BBC News Mundo.
TambiÃ©n puedes seguirnos en YouTube , Instagram , TikTok , X , Facebook y en nuestro nuevo canal de WhatsApp , donde encontrarÃ¡s noticias de Ãºltima hora y nuestro mejor contenido.
Y recuerda que puedes recibir notificaciones en nuestra app. Descarga la Ãºltima versiÃ³n y actÃ­valas .
â€œLos problemas que vemos en HaitÃ­ han sido perpetuados por las organizaciones internacionalesâ€ Â¿EstÃ¡ mi familia viva?: la pregunta que se hacen muchos haitianos cada maÃ±ana cuando prenden su telÃ©fono Cabo Haitiano, la ciudad que aÃºn estÃ¡ a salvo de la violencia de las pandillas en HaitÃ­ y se convirtiÃ³ en un refugio para los que huyen

author: NewsBreak Original
title: How Colorado auto and catalytic converter theft victims can get money back
text: Coloradans who had a vehicle or catalytic converter stolen in 2023 may be able to get money to help offset some of the costs of dealing with theft thanks to new funds made available though the state. SB23-257, or the Auto Theft Prevention Cash Fund, made available roughly $5 million of general funds to support victims who need help with secondary costs. â€œThe secondary costs arenâ€™t things like vehicle replacement, or vehicle repair, those would be primary costs. These are secondary things that may be unknown to folks when their vehicle is stolen or recovered that we can assist with,â€ said Cale Gould, Public Outreach Coordinator with the Colorado Auto Theft Prevention Authority. Fees covered include money to help offset the costs of towing and storing a stolen vehicle. Gould said some of the fees covered are part of dealing with theft that people might not consider. â€œGenerally if it is either operable or part of a larger investigation, it is taken to a tow yard or a police impound lot. And there's fees associated with that,â€ said Gould. When auto theft victims in Colorado do get their vehicle back, they often find it to be in a less than desirable condition. There is assistance to help cover some of the costs of getting the stolen ride back into better condition. â€œAnd this will include detailing, cleaning a vehicle to make it again, you know, usable in a comfortable way,â€ said Gould. Financial assistance might also be available to help cover the costs of temporary transportation like RTD passes and Uber fees when a vehicle is stolen. Catalytic converter theft in Colorado has skyrocketed over the last few years and the state has made available funds to help those victims with secondary costs. Gould said victims can apply for money to help cover hardening devices to protect your catalytic converter from theft. To qualify for assistance for either auto or catalytic converter theft, the vehicle must have had current registration when the theft occurred. An important date to remember is July 1, 2023. Coloradans can apply for help only if they had their vehicle or catalytic converter stolen after July 1. Coloradans who want to get financial help to cover secondary costs due to auto or catalytic converter theft must apply at lockdownyourcar.org and visit the victimâ€™s assistance page. The site details what is covered and how to apply. Gould said the grant application process is made easier by working through a local advocate. â€œWe try and provide a personal response, personal touch to a single person to guide you through the process as it can be very challenging to understand how to apply,â€ said Gould. â€œWe want to make sure that everybody applies and has guidance in doing such.â€ The website, through Colorado State Patrolâ€™s Victim Services Unit lists the various districts throughout the state and which advocate serves your local area. While auto theft in Colorado surged over the last couple of years, the state has seen a decline in 2023. Data from the Colorado Auto Theft Prevention Authority showed 29,098 vehicles were stolen through October of this year. That's a significant decline from the 41,184 vehicles reported stolen in Colorado throughout 2022. The 2023 data does not reflect November or December thefts. The Denver Police Department also reported a 25 percent decline in auto thefts in 2023, showing 11,865 stolen vehicles which is down from the 14,813 reported in 2022. While auto thefts in Denver have declined, catalytic converter thefts continued to climb in data reported by DPD in 2023. DPD statistics showed 3,022 stolen catalytic converters this year compared to 2,676 thefts in 2022. To give context in those numbers, the vast majority of increases in catalytic converter theft in Denver happened at Denver International Airport at DIA's associated parking and rental car lots. There was a staggering 857 percent increase in catalytic converter theft at DIA in 2023. According to DPD's statistics, all other police districts showed a year-over-year decline in catalytic converter thefts.

author: Olly Keell
title: Roamless review 2025: Is this travel eSIM worth it?
text:
Roamless is a global eSIM provider offering pay-as-you-go mobile data for travelers looking to stay connected without the hassle of swapping out physical SIM cards. But does it deliver the affordable data and reliable coverage it promises?
In this review, weâ€™ll break down Roamlessâ€™s pricing, coverage, features, and user feedback to help you decide if it fits your travel style. Youâ€™ll also see how Roamless compares to other eSIM providers, including Holaflyâ€™s unlimited eSIM.
An eSIM you can rely on
Join over 1 million customers and get connected with our trusted, global services.
Learn more How does Roamless work? Roamless is a pay-as-you-go global eSIM that lets you stay connected in 186 countries. Hereâ€™s how it works:
Download the Roamless app (iOS/Android) or go to the website and create an account. Note that in specific regions like the UAE, in-app eSIM installation might not be available. Add funds to your Roamless wallet. Choose a data plan based on the amount of data you need from the preset plans. Activate your eSIM by scanning the QR code sent via email. Enable Data Roaming and select Roamless as your data provider. Roamless has specific conditions for in-app eSIM installation in the UAE. Source: Roamless eSIM ğŸ’¡ Not sure if your phone supports eSIM? Follow these steps to see if your device is ready to keep you connected on the go! Roamless pros and cons Hereâ€™s a quick breakdown of Roamless pros and cons:
Pros Cons Coverage in 187 destinations Roamless has higher prices and no unlimited data plans, with examples like their Portugal eSIM offering 40 GB for $100 USD. In contrast, Hoalfy offers unlimited data for $6.90, providing more data at a significantly lower cost across various locations. No Expiry Credits. Funds never expire, making it ideal for irregular travelers or those needing backup data. No live chat on the website or app â€” you must fill out a form and wait for a response. Roams on major networks (e.g., AT&T, T-Mobile in the US; Proximus/BICS in Europe), ensuring reliable coverage and fallback options Data-only plans with no option to get a phone number Roamless eSIM review: Is it any good? So, how does Roamless stack up in terms of price, coverage, and overall experience? Letâ€™s break it down.
1. Pricing While Roamless offers flexibility and affordable data rates, it doesnâ€™t include unlimited data options . For example, their eSIM for Lisbon looks like this:
1 GB for $2.45 2 GB for $4.90 3 GB for $7.35 5 GB for $12.25 And 10 GB for $24.50 You only pay for the data you use , so you donâ€™t have to worry about expiration dates. And if you need more data, simply add funds to your Roamless wallet to purchase additional data.
Roamless eSIM for USA is available in preset fixed-data plans. Source: Roamless 2. Network coverage and quality Roamless offers eSIMs in 187 destinations, connecting to many major eSIM carriers for broader coverage.
In Lisbon, for example, it connects to MEO (5G) and NOS (5G), two of Portugalâ€™s major networks.
However, like all eSIM providers, the experience depends on the carrierâ€™s network quality in specific locations. If youâ€™re traveling to remote or rural areas, coverage may vary.
Roamless offers eSIM across 187 destinations. Source: Roamless ğŸ›œ Not sure how much data you need? Check out Holaflyâ€™s data usage calculator . Just drag the sliders to match your daily scroll sessions â€” whether youâ€™re a casual Googler or a Netflix-on-the-go kind of traveler. 3. Customer service and technical support Roamless offers support through their troubleshooting FAQs and a feedback form users can fill in on the website and app.
However, it doesnâ€™t feature chatbots, call centers, or other direct support channels. This can have a say on response times and customer satisfaction. Roamlessâ€™ 3.3-star rating on Google Play Store is impacted by some reviews that address slow customer service response times.
4. Roamless app review Roamless offers a dedicated app for iOS and Android. The app allows users to purchase and add funds to their eSIM via credit or debit card, which are converted into GB of data.
Available top-up options include $5, $10, $20, and $50 , with the amount of data varying based on destination. Users can also purchase call credits in the app.
eSIM activation is straightforward, with clear instructions provided. The app includes a data usage dashboard where users can track their usage for the current day, month, and previous month. However, detailed historical data is not available.
For support, users can submit a feedback form within the app, as there are no direct contact lines available .
Some users had a positive experience, describing the installation process as â€œvery easy and straightforward.â€
However, not everyone shares the same enthusiasm. Another user criticized the app for being â€œ very slow â€ and plagued by â€œ too many forced updates .â€ He pointed out that even simple tasks like checking your balance often required yet another unnecessary update, making the app frustrating to use.
Roamless mobile app. Source: Roamless 5. Roamless member program If youâ€™re new to Roamless, you can kick things off with a nice little bonus. Youâ€™ll get $20 in credits for just $10. Roamless also offers a referral program that rewards both you and your friends. Hereâ€™s how it works:
Find your referral code in the Roamless app under â€œ Get Free Credits. â€ Share your code with friends. Theyâ€™ll use it when they sign up. Earn credits when they make their first purchase â€” you both get $5. The best part? Thereâ€™s no limit. Roamless says youâ€™ll earn credits â€œevery single timeâ€ someone uses your code.
Get unlimited data with Holafly If youâ€™re looking for unlimited data and peace of mind as you travel, Holafly is the best choice.
Holafly connects you to local networks in over 200 destinations , so you get a fast, stable connection wherever you go.
There are customizable unlimited data plans based on how long youâ€™re traveling â€” whether itâ€™s 1 day or 90 days .
Setting up a Holafly eSIM is effortless â€” after purchase, youâ€™ll get a QR code via email. Scan the code, and youâ€™re connected. And if you run into any issues, Holaflyâ€™s 24/7 live chat support is ready to help with quick, friendly responses that actually solve problems .
24/7 support, no matter what
When you're traveling, every question can be an urgent one. That's why we work around the clock.
Discover more
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->products and services

author: Tim Adams
title: Captain America: Brave New World Releases an Extended First Look for Fans
text:
Weâ€™re just under a month until the release of Captain America: Brave New World, and the Marvel film is providing fans with a special behind-the-scenes look at the making of the Marvel Cinematic Universe epic. The film marks Anthony Mackieâ€™s first starring role as Captain America on the big screen, following the events of The Falcon and the Winter Soldier. A behind-the-scenes featurette released by Marvel features Anthony Mackie (Sam Wilson/Captain America), Harrison Ford (Thaddeus â€œThunderboltâ€ Ross), and Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige.
Videos by ComicBook.com
Past looks at Captain America: Brave New World have featured a showdown between Sam Wilson and Thunderbolt Ross, who is President of the United States and will transform into the Red Hulk. Thanks to Tide, fans got to see Thaddeus â€œHulk Outâ€ and attack Captain America, punching our hero and sending him ricocheting against parked cars. There was also a look at Thaddeus turning into Red Hulk on the White House lawn as reporters scatter. As for what Captain America: Brave New World has in store for fans, you can take a look at the video below.
RELATED: [Captain Americaâ€™s 4â€™s New Falcon Has a Weird, Tragic Origin (but Will We See It in the MCU?)]
Tracking for the opening weekend of Captain America: Brave New World is out, and itâ€™s already looking positive. The film is projected to open with upwards of $95 million during the Valentineâ€™s Day/Presidentâ€™s Day weekend. The final numbers could fall anywhere between $86 million to $95 million, and could exceed $100 million for the 4-day Fridayâ€”Monday through Presidentsâ€™ Day on February 17th.
A box office number in the $95 million range would put Captain America: Brave New World on par with 2014â€™s Captain America: The Winter Soldier, the movie that introduced Sam Wilson to the MCU as Falcon.
Fans are anticipating the fourth Captain America movie to change the MCU in several ways. First up we have the debut of Red Hulk, as Harrison Ford takes over the role of Thaddeus Ross from the late William Hurt. Thereâ€™s also Joaquin Torres (Danny Ramirez), who fans met in The Falcon and the Winter Soldier, suiting up as the new Falcon, and the introduction of Adamantium. The indestructible metal is mostly associated with Wolverine, so that by itself is enough to spark interest.
Adamantium comes courtesy of the Celestial Tiamut from Eternals, whose body is still sticking out of the ground in the middle of the ocean. Thereâ€™s an arms race between different government agencies and other shady organizations to get their hands on the precious Adamantium, which factors into Brave New Worldâ€˜s plot in a major way.
Let us know your thoughts on the new Captain America: Brave New World footage on social media @ComicBook. The movie opens in theaters on February 13th.

author: world today news
title: Major Fire Breaks Out in Heerhugowaard - N242 Closed, Efforts to Prevent Spread - World Today News
text: A major fire broke out in a garage on Nijverheidsstraat in Heerhugowaard late this evening. The fire brigade is present in large numbers and a large area is currently being cordoned off. The N242 is closed, and the fire brigade is calling on people to stay away from the smoke. video-caption">First images of major fire Heerhugowaard â€“ VLN News Initial images show flames shooting out of the roof of the company. The fire may spread more quickly because the wind is blowing very hard in the region, thanks to storm Gerrit. According to the fire brigade, the building where the fire started has completely burned out and can be considered a loss. Efforts are now being made to prevent spillover to other buildings. The fire started around 10:30 PM and the police are busy cordoning off a large area around the building. The company is located close to the Heerhugowaard train station, but for the time being there appear to be no disruptions to the train connection. The N242 runs on the other side of the company. Due to the smoke development, it was closed by the emergency services near Heerhugowaard. It is unclear for how long. The fire brigade warns people to stay away from the smoke. Measurements are taken to see exactly how far the smoke spreads. The fire brigade has warned people not to approach the fire. They emphatically ask for space to be given to the emergency services. It is currently unclear whether people were still present in the building when the fire broke out. It is also not yet known whether there have been any injuries. To view this content you must accept cookies. Manage cookies ğŸ’¬ Donâ€™t want to miss anything from Alkmaar and the surrounding area? Spotted a typo? Let us know via [email protected] 2023-12-28 22:05:41 #Giant #fire #Heerhugowaard #garage #N242 #closed #smoke

author: AFP
title: Allemagne: les salariÃ©s de Volkswagen appelÃ©s Ã  la grÃ¨ve Ã  partir de lundi
text:
Allemagne: les salariÃ©s de Volkswagen appelÃ©s Ã  la grÃ¨ve Ã  partir de lundi
Les salariÃ©s de Volkswagen sont appelÃ©s Ã  cesser le travail Ã  partir de lundi dans les usines allemandes pour s'opposer aux milliers de suppressions d'emplois envisagÃ©es, a annoncÃ© dimanche le syndicat IG Metall.
Â«Si nÃ©cessaire, ce sera la bataille de nÃ©gociation collective la plus dure que Volkswagen ait jamais connueÂ», prÃ©vient dans un communiquÃ© le nÃ©gociateur du syndicat, Thorsten GrÃ¶ger, Ã  l'issue de la pÃ©riode de dialogue social obligatoire pour 120 000 employÃ©s de la marque en Allemagne.
Vendredi, le constructeur, qui prÃ©pare un plan drastique d'Ã©conomies, avait rejetÃ© une contre-proposition syndicale visant Ã  rÃ©duire les coÃ»ts sans avoir Ã  fermer d'usines en Allemagne, laissant augurer d'un durcissement du dialogue social.
Â«Des grÃ¨ves d'avertissement commenceront lundi dans toutes les usinesÂ», indique M. GrÃ¶ger, qui tient la direction Â«responsable, Ã  la table des nÃ©gociations, de la durÃ©e et de l'intensitÃ© de cet affrontementÂ».
Dans un communiquÃ© sÃ©parÃ©, Volkswagen a dit Â«respecter le droit des salariÃ©s Ã  participer Ã  une grÃ¨ve d'avertissementÂ» et dit croire en la poursuite d'un Â«dialogue constructifÂ» pour Â«parvenir Ã  une solution durable et soutenue collectivementÂ».
L'entreprise prÃ©cise avoir Â«anticipÃ© des mesures ciblÃ©es pour sÃ©curiser l'approvisionnement d'urgenceÂ» pendant le mouvement, et ce afin de Â«limiter autant que possibleÂ» son impact Â«sur nos clients, nos partenaires et nos installations industriellesÂ».
Alors que Volkswagen a annoncÃ© en septembre travailler sur un programme pour redresser sa compÃ©titivitÃ©, les discussions en cours entre la direction et les responsables syndicaux, en vertu du principe de cogestion, n'ont pas permis de trouver d'accord sur les mesures de restructuration.
Les reprÃ©sentants des salariÃ©s avaient prÃ©sentÃ© en novembre une contre-proposition incluant la suspension de bonus, d'augmentations de salaires, un allÃ¨gement du temps de travail, permettant, selon eux, d'Ã©viter fermetures d'usines en Allemagne et licenciements en masse.
Mais cette offre n'a pas Ã©tÃ© jugÃ©e viable par la direction.
Les reprÃ©sentants du personnel affirment qu'au moins trois usines Volkswagen risquent de fermer en Allemagne et que des dizaines de milliers d'emplois pourraient Ãªtre supprimÃ©s, les employÃ©s restants devant consentir Ã  des rÃ©ductions de salaire.
Dans le pays, Volkswagen compte dix sites de production de voitures et environ 300 000 salariÃ©s, dont 120 000 pour la marque VW, la plus concernÃ©e par le plan d'Ã©conomies.
Fleuron de l'industrie automobile allemande, Volkswagen souffre Ã  la fois du ralentissement du marchÃ© des vÃ©hicules neufs, de la concurrence chinoise, de modÃ¨les Ã  batterie pas assez attractifs, et de coÃ»ts de main dâ€™Å“uvre plus Ã©levÃ©s que ses rivaux, selon les experts.

author: @wymt
title: Floyd Co. shelter housing hope this winter
text: Floyd Co. shelter housing hope this winter MARTIN, Ky. (WYMT) - For some people in Floyd County, escaping the winter weather is a challenge. â€œPeople in a rural area, like where we live, are embarrassed about being homeless. They donâ€™t want to be identified as homeless,â€ said Mickey McGuire, Attorney for the Floyd County Homeless Shelter. [The Maddiwar House of Hope](https://floydcohomelessshelter.com/) has open beds as the winter months continue, with representatives saying they are working hard to connect people with the resources they need. â€œWe get people in and theyâ€™re allowed to stay for several months if they need to. But what we try to do is get them un-homeless,â€ said McGuire. â€œAnd, so, sometimes we keep people for a few weeks and and they find something or work something out. Sometimes, it takes months and months and months.â€ The goal, according to McGuire, is to get people back on their feet, heading toward the brightest future possible. The shelter was able to connect six people with housing to kick off the New Year, which means more room for neighbors in need of shelter. â€œWhere we have openings, what it really kind of says is weâ€™re doing a really good job,â€ said McGuire. â€œBecause weâ€™re moving people out that were here.â€ With needs being met by the shelter, the shelter has needs as well. Program Facilitator Deborah Brown said the community steps in to help feed the clients at the shelter- signing up to bring lunch and dinner on specific days of the month.
